description.para: The key parameter is specified in the form of a Unicode code point. This is generally an ASCII character such as 'A' or a key constant such as B_RIGHT_ARROW. To use a UTF-8 character you must first convert it to a Unicode code point using BUnicodeChar::FromUTF8().

briefdescription.para: Creates a keyboard shortcut that sends a message to the window.

simplesect.para: Don't use this method to a create menu shortcut, add a BMenuItem instead.

parameterdescription.para: The character that activates the shortcut, case-insensitive.

A bit mask of modifiers in addition to B_COMMAND_KEY, options include:
B_SHIFT_KEY
B_OPTION_KEY
B_CONTROL_KEY
B_MENU_KEY
The message to send when the shortcut is activated. The BWindow takes ownership of the message.

briefdescription.para: Creates a keyboard shortcut that sends a message to the specified target.

simplesect.para: Don't use this method to a create menu shortcut, add a BMenuItem instead.

parameterdescription.para: The character that activates the shortcut, case-insensitive.

A bit mask of modifiers in addition to B_COMMAND_KEY, options include one or more of the following:
B_SHIFT_KEY
B_OPTION_KEY
B_CONTROL_KEY
B_MENU_KEY
The message to send when the shortcut is activated. The BWindow takes ownership of the message.
The handler to send the message to.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the specified shortcut is set on the window.

parameterdescription.para: The character to check, case-insensitive.

A bit mask of modifiers in addition to B_COMMAND_KEY, options include one or more of the following:
B_SHIFT_KEY
B_OPTION_KEY
B_CONTROL_KEY
B_MENU_KEY

simplesect.para: true if the window has the specified shortcut, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Removes the specified shortcut from the window.

detaileddescription.para: The memory used by the shortcut message is freed.

parameterdescription.para: The character to remove, case-insensitive.

A bit mask of modifiers in addition to B_COMMAND_KEY, options include one or more of the following:
B_SHIFT_KEY
B_OPTION_KEY
B_CONTROL_KEY
B_MENU_KEY

briefdescription.para: Creates a keyboard shortcut that activates a menu item.

parameterdescription.para: The character that activates the shortcut, case-insensitive.

A bit mask of modifiers in addition to B_COMMAND_KEY, options include:
B_SHIFT_KEY
B_OPTION_KEY
B_CONTROL_KEY
B_MENU_KEY
The menu item to activate.

briefdescription.para: Archive constructor.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BMessage object to build the object from.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, const char *title, window_look look, window_feel feel, uint32 flags, uint32 workspace=B_CURRENT_WORKSPACE)
memberdef.name: BWindow

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BWindow object with the specified look and feel.

parameterdescription.para: The inner frame rectangle in the screen coordinate system.
The window title and thread title as "w>title".

The window_look flags, one of the following:
B_BORDERED_WINDOW_LOOK No title bar, thin border, no resize control.
B_NO_BORDER_WINDOW_LOOK A borderless rectangle with no provisions to move or close the window.
B_TITLED_WINDOW_LOOK Like B_DOCUMENT_WINDOW_LOOK, but with a resize corner instead of a resize thumb.
B_DOCUMENT_WINDOW_LOOK Large title bar, thick border, draggable resize corner thumb.
B_MODAL_WINDOW_LOOK For modal dialogs: no title bar, thick border, resize corner depending on the B_NOT_RESIZABLE flag.
B_FLOATING_WINDOW_LOOK For floating sub windows: small title bar, thin border, resize corner.

The window_feel flags, one of the following:
B_NORMAL_WINDOW_FEEL Behaves like a normal, non-modal, non-floating window.
B_MODAL_SUBSET_WINDOW_FEEL Blocks all windows in its subset when displayed. Visible only if a window in its subset is visible.
B_MODAL_APP_WINDOW_FEEL Blocks all windows in its app when displayed. Visible only if a window in its app is visible.
B_MODAL_ALL_WINDOW_FEEL Blocks all windows across the entire system when displayed. Always visible in all workspaces.
B_FLOATING_SUBSET_WINDOW_FEEL Floats above all windows in its subset when displayed. Visible only if a window in its subset is the frontmost window.
B_FLOATING_APP_WINDOW_FEEL Floats above all windows in its app when displayed. Visible only if a window in its app is the frontmost window.
B_FLOATING_ALL_WINDOW_FEEL Floats above all windows across the entire system when displayed. Always visible in all workspaces.

Mask that defines window attributes:
B_NOT_MOVABLE cannot be moved by the user
B_NOT_CLOSABLE cannot be closed by the user, no close button displayed
B_NOT_ZOOMABLE cannot be zoomed by the user, no zoom button displayed
B_NOT_MINIMIZABLE cannot be minimized by the user
B_NOT_RESIZABLE cannot be resized by the user
B_NOT_H_RESIZABLE cannot be resized horizontally by the user
B_NOT_V_RESIZABLE cannot be resized vertically by the user
B_AVOID_FRONT cannot be brought to front by the user
B_AVOID_FOCUS cannot receive keyboard focus
B_WILL_ACCEPT_FIRST_CLICK The first click is processed by the window.
B_OUTLINE_RESIZE draws only its outline as it's resized and doesn't draw its contents.
B_NO_WORKSPACE_ACTIVATION Causes the current workspace to stay active when activated on another workspace.
B_NOT_ANCHORED_ON_ACTIVATE Causes the window to move to the current workspace when activated if it already exists on another workspace.
B_QUIT_ON_WINDOW_CLOSE Quit the application when the window closes.
B_SAME_POSITION_IN_ALL_WORKSPACES Window maintains its position across workspaces.
B_AUTO_UPDATE_SIZE_LIMITS Automatically adjust the size according to layout constraints.
B_CLOSE_ON_ESCAPE Close when the user pushes the Escape key.
B_NO_SERVER_SIDE_WINDOW_MODIFIERS ??
Mask that indicates which of the 32 potential workspace(s) the window should be displayed in or B_CURRENT_WORKSPACE or B_ALL_WORKSPACES constants.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, const char *title, window_type type, uint32 flags, uint32 workspace=B_CURRENT_WORKSPACE)
memberdef.name: BWindow

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BWindow object.

parameterdescription.para: The inner frame rectangle in the screen coordinate system.
The window title and thread title as "w>title".

window_type flag, one of the following:
B_UNTYPED_WINDOW
B_TITLED_WINDOW
B_MODAL_WINDOW
B_DOCUMENT_WINDOW
B_BORDERED_WINDOW
B_FLOATING_WINDOW

Mask that defines window attributes:
B_NOT_MOVABLE cannot be moved by the user
B_NOT_CLOSABLE cannot be closed by the user, no close button displayed
B_NOT_ZOOMABLE cannot be zoomed by the user, no zoom button displayed
B_NOT_MINIMIZABLE cannot be minimized by the user
B_NOT_RESIZABLE cannot be resized by the user
B_NOT_H_RESIZABLE cannot be resized horizontally by the user
B_NOT_V_RESIZABLE cannot be resized vertically by the user
B_AVOID_FRONT cannot be brought to front by the user
B_AVOID_FOCUS cannot receive keyboard focus
B_WILL_ACCEPT_FIRST_CLICK The first click is processed by the window.
B_OUTLINE_RESIZE draws only its outline as it's resized and doesn't draw its contents.
B_NO_WORKSPACE_ACTIVATION Causes the current workspace to stay active when activated on another workspace.
B_NOT_ANCHORED_ON_ACTIVATE Causes the window to move to the current workspace when activated if it already exists on another workspace.
B_QUIT_ON_WINDOW_CLOSE Quit the application when the window closes.
B_SAME_POSITION_IN_ALL_WORKSPACES Window maintains its position across workspaces.
B_AUTO_UPDATE_SIZE_LIMITS Automatically adjust the size according to layout constraints.
B_CLOSE_ON_ESCAPE Close when the user pushes the Escape key.
B_NO_SERVER_SIDE_WINDOW_MODIFIERS ??
Mask that indicates which of the 32 potential workspace(s) the window should be displayed in or B_CURRENT_WORKSPACE or B_ALL_WORKSPACES constants.

briefdescription.para: Destroys the BWindow object and all attached views.
Activates or deactivates the window based on active.

detaileddescription.para: The title tab of the active window is drawn more brightly, the window is made frontmost, and it becomes the target of keyboard events. Calling Show() automatically activates the window calling the WindowActivated() hook method.

parameterdescription.para: true to activate the window, false to deactivate the window.

briefdescription.para: Add the child layout item to the view hierarchy.

parameterdescription.para: The child layout item to add.

briefdescription.para: Adds child to the view hierarchy immediately before before.

detaileddescription.para: A view may only have one parent at a time so child must not have already been added to the view hierarchy. If before is NULL then child is added to the end of the view hierarchy.
The AttachedToWindow() method is invoked on child and all of its descendent views.

parameterdescription.para: The child view to add.
The sibling view to add child before.

briefdescription.para: Adds window to be in the subset of the BWindow.

parameterdescription.para: window was added as a subset of the BWindow.
window is not B_NORMAL_WINDOW_FEEL or the BWindow object's feel is not set to B_MODAL_SUBSET_WINDOW_FEEL or B_FLOATING_SUBSET_WINDOW_FEEL.
Could not lock the BWindow object.

briefdescription.para: Archives the object into the data message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BMessage object to archive the object into.
Whether or not to archive child views as well.

simplesect.para: A status code, B_OK if the object was archived or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Stall updates to App Server allowing you to batch drawing commands to limit flickering.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike DisableUpdates() the messages are sent but are not processed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the bounding rectangle of the window.

simplesect.para: The bounding rectangle of the window as a BRect in the window's coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Center the window in rect.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to center the window in.

briefdescription.para: Centers the window on the screen the window is currently on.
Centers the window on the screen with the passed in id.
Returns a pointer to the child view found at index.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the child view to return a pointer of.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the child view at index or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Deprecated alias for BWindow::Quit().

detaileddescription.para: The advised way to close a window is to use BWindow::Quit().

briefdescription.para: Convert point from the screen's coordinate system to the window's coordinate system in place.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a BPoint object to convert.

briefdescription.para: Returns point converted from the screen's coordinate system to the window's coordinate system.

parameterdescription.para: A BPoint object to convert.

simplesect.para: A new BPoint object in the window's coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Convert rect from the screen's coordinate system to the window's coordinate system in place.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a BRect object to convert.

briefdescription.para: Returns rect converted from the screen's coordinate system to the window's coordinate system.

parameterdescription.para: A BRect object to convert.

simplesect.para: A new BRect object in the window's coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Convert point to the screen's coordinate system in place.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a BPoint object to convert.

briefdescription.para: Returns point converted to the screen's coordinate system.

parameterdescription.para: A BPoint object to convert.

simplesect.para: A new BPoint object in the screen's coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Convert rect to the screen's coordinate system in place.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a BRect object to convert.

briefdescription.para: Returns rect converted to the screen's coordinate system.

parameterdescription.para: A BRect object to convert.

simplesect.para: A new BRect object in the screen's coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of child views that the window has.

simplesect.para: The number of child views as an int32.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the current focus view of the window.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the current focus view of the window or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the frame rectangle of the window decorator.

simplesect.para: The bounding rectangle of the window decorator as a BRect in the screen coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the default button set on the window.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the window's default button or NULL if it doesn't have one.

briefdescription.para: Suppresses drawing within the window.

detaileddescription.para: If you want the results of several drawing operations to appear in the window all at once you disable updates, draw, and then re-enable updates.

briefdescription.para: Window's central message-processing method.

detaileddescription.para: This method called automatically as messages arrive in the queue, you should never call DispatchMessage() yourself.

simplesect.para: Don't override this method in your BWindow subclass. Override MessageReceived() instead to alter the window's message dispatching mechanism.

briefdescription.para: Re-enable drawing within the window.

detaileddescription.para: If you want the results of several drawing operations to appear in the window all at once you disable updates, draw, and then re-enable updates.

briefdescription.para: Ends a view transaction allowing update to go to App Server again.
Returns the current window feel flag.

simplesect.para: The currently set window feel flag.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the attached view located at the specified point.

parameterdescription.para: The point to get the view at in the window's coordinate system.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the BView object or NULL if no view is found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the attached view with the specified viewName.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the attached view to look for.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the BView object or NULL if no view is found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current window flags.
Flushes the window's connection to App Server causing any pending messages to be processed then returns immediately.
Returns the frame rectangle of the window.

simplesect.para: The bounding rectangle of the window as a BRect in the screen coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Hook method that gets called when the window is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The point of the top left corner of the frame rectangle that the window has been moved to.

briefdescription.para: Hook method that gets called when the window is resized.

parameterdescription.para: The new width of the window.
The new height of the window.

briefdescription.para: Fill out the window's decorator settings into settings.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a BMessage object to fill out.

simplesect.para: B_OK if the decorator settings were filled out successfully or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the layout of the window.
Fills out the size limits set on the window.

parameterdescription.para: The minimum width of the window.
The maximum width of the window.
The minimum height of the window.
The maximum height of the window.

briefdescription.para: Reports the suites of messages and specifiers understood by the window.

memberdef.argsstring: (window_alignment *mode=NULL, int32 *h=NULL, int32 *hOffset=NULL, int32 *width=NULL, int32 *widthOffset=NULL, int32 *v=NULL, int32 *vOffset=NULL, int32 *height=NULL, int32 *heightOffset=NULL) const
memberdef.name: GetWindowAlignment

briefdescription.para: Fills out the pointers with the alignment of the content of the window on the screen.
Removes the window from the screen, removes it from Deskbar's window list, and passes active status to another window.

detaileddescription.para: Calls to Hide() and Show() are cumulative.

briefdescription.para: Invalidate layout.

parameterdescription.para: Also invalidate its children windows.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the window is currently in a view transaction.

simplesect.para: true if the window is currently in a view transaction, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the window is active.

simplesect.para: true if the window is active, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the window is floating.

simplesect.para: true if the window is floating, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the window is the frontmost on screen.

simplesect.para: true if window is the frontmost on screen, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the window is hidden.

detaileddescription.para: Windows are hidden by default, you must call Show() to show the window starting the message loop going.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the window is minimized.

simplesect.para: true if the window is minimized, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the window is modal.

simplesect.para: true if the window is modal, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Tests if window is used for drawing into a BBitmap. This is mostly used by the Interface Kit itself.

simplesect.para: True if the window is used for drawing into a BBitmap.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the key menu bar set to the window.

detaileddescription.para: If the window contains only one menu bar it is automatically considered to be the key menu bar for the window. If more than one menu bar is attached to the window then the last one added to the window's view hierarchy is considered to be the key menu bar for the window.
To explicitly set a menu bar as the key menu bar call SetKeyMenuBar().

simplesect.para: A pointer to the key menu bar or NULL is not is set.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the attached view that most recently received a B_MOUSE_MOVED message.

simplesect.para: A pointer the BView object that most recently received a B_MOUSE_MOVED message or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Update the size limits and do the layout of the topmost view attached to the window.

parameterdescription.para: If true, layout even if valid.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current window look flag.

simplesect.para: The currently set window look flag.

briefdescription.para: Hook method that gets called just before a menu owned by the window is shown.

simplesect.para: This method is not invoked by a message, there is no B_MENUS_BEGINNING flag.

briefdescription.para: Hook method that gets called just before a menu owned by the window is hidden.

simplesect.para: This method is not invoked by a message, there is no B_MENUS_ENDED flag.

briefdescription.para: Handle message received by the associated looper.

parameterdescription.para: The message received by the looper.

briefdescription.para: Minimizes or un-minimizes the window based on minimize.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike Hide() an Show(), Minimize() dims and un-dims the entry for the window in Deskbar's window list rather than removing it. Also Minimize() calls are not cumulative like Hide() and Show(); one false call will undo multiple true calls.

Minimize() also acts as a hook method that is invoked when the user double- clicks on the title tab of the window or selects the window from the DeskBar window list. The minimize parameter is true if the window is about to be hidden and false if it is about to be shown.
If you override Minimize() and you want to inherit BWindow's behavior, you must call BWindow::Minimize().

briefdescription.para: Move the window by dx pixels horizontally and dy pixels vertically.

detaileddescription.para: dx and dy must be integral units.

parameterdescription.para: The number of pixels to move the window vertically.
The number of pixels to move the window horizontally.

briefdescription.para: Update window size and position to make it visible on screen.

detaileddescription.para: This convenience method helps you to automatically move and resize a window to make it visible on the screen, in case the window is partially off screen because of its size or its position. This method will do nothing if the window fits on the screen.

The default behavior is as follows:
If the window size is larger than the screen, the window is resized so that it fits on the screen.
If the window is still partially off-screen, it will then be centered horizontally and vertically so that it is fully visible.

Note that this does not affect window size and positions for windows that are currently visible on the screen. Also note that this method does not affect whether the window is covered by other windows that are on top. You can use BWindow::Activate() to bring a window to the top.

The behavior of this method can be altered by passing either or both of the following modifiers in the flags parameter:
B_DO_NOT_RESIZE_TO_FIT Do not resize the window. If the window is too large to be on the screen, then it will at least be moved so that the left-top of the window is visible, and only the right and/or bottom of the window will be off screen.
B_MOVE_IF_PARTIALLY_OFFSCREEN Use this parameter if instead of centering the window in the middle of the screen, you only want to do the minimum movement so that at least the top left part of the window is visible on screen.

parameterdescription.para: Can be 0 for the default behavior, or a any combination of B_DO_NOT_RESIZE_TO_FIT and B_MOVE_IF_PARTIALLY_OFFSCREEN.

briefdescription.para: Move the window to point.

parameterdescription.para: the location to move the window in the screen's coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Move the window to the specified x and y coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: x and y must be integral units.

parameterdescription.para: The horizontal coordinate to move the window to in the screen's coordinate system.
The vertical coordinate to move the window to in the screen's coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not any of the attached views need to be updated.

simplesect.para: true if an attached view needs to be updated, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Internal method.
Returns the pulse rate of the window.

detaileddescription.para: B_PULSE messages are sent by default every 500,000 microseconds provided that no other messages are pending.

simplesect.para: The pulse rate of the window as a bigtime_t.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the window and all child views, destroys the window thread, removes the window's connection to the Application Server, and deletes the object.

detaileddescription.para: Use this method to destroy a window rather than using the delete operator.

This method works much like the BLooper::Quit(), it doesn't return when called from the BWindow's thread and it returns after all messages have been processed when called from another thread and the BWindow and its thread has been destroyed.

simplesect.para: The window must first be locked before calling Quit().

briefdescription.para: Hook method that gets called when the window receives a B_QUIT_REQUESTED message.
Removes child from the view hierarchy.

parameterdescription.para: The child view to remove.

simplesect.para: Whether or not child was removed from the view hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Remove window from the subset of the BWindow.

parameterdescription.para: window was removed from the subset of the BWindow.
window is not B_NORMAL_WINDOW_FEEL or the BWindow object's feel is not set to B_MODAL_SUBSET_WINDOW_FEEL or B_FLOATING_SUBSET_WINDOW_FEEL.
Could not lock the BWindow object.

briefdescription.para: Resize the window by dx pixels horizontally and dy pixels vertically.

detaileddescription.para: dx and dy must be integral units.
dx The number of pixels to resize the window horizontally.
dy The number of pixels to resize the window vertically.

briefdescription.para: Resize the window to the specified width and height.

detaileddescription.para: width and height must be integral units.

parameterdescription.para: The width to resize the window to.
The height to resize the window to.

briefdescription.para: Resize the window to the preferred size of the window's layout.

memberdef.argsstring: (BMessage *message, int32 index, BMessage *specifier, int32 what, const char *property)
memberdef.name: ResolveSpecifier

detaileddescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

parameterdescription.para: The scripting message to determine the handler.
The index of the specifier.
The message which contains the specifier.
The 'what' field of the specifier message.
The name of the target property.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the proper BHandler for the given scripting message.

briefdescription.para: Spawns the message loop thread and starts the window running.
Hook method that is called when the screen that the window is located on changes size or location or the color space of the screen changes.

parameterdescription.para: The new screen size in the screen's coordinate system.
The new color space of the screen.

briefdescription.para: Moves the BWindow object behind window.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the window to move behind.

simplesect.para: B_OK on success or B_ERROR on failure.

briefdescription.para: Set the window decorator settings according to settings.

parameterdescription.para: The decorator settings message to set.

simplesect.para: B_OK if the decorator settings were set successfully or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the default button of the window to button.

detaileddescription.para: The default button has a grey outline and is activated by the user pushing the Enter key. The user can activate the default button even if another view is currently set to be the focus view of the window.
A window may only have one default button at a time, to remove the current default without setting another button you may pass in NULL.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the button to set as the default or NULL to unset.

briefdescription.para: Changes the window feel set in the constructor to feel.

simplesect.para: B_OK on success or an error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Changes the window flags set in the constructor to flags.

simplesect.para: B_OK on success or an error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Set the specified menu bar as the key menu bar for the window.

detaileddescription.para: The key menu bar is the one located at the top of the window at the root of the menu hierarchy that the user can navigate with the keyboard.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the menu bar to set as as the key menu bar for the window.

briefdescription.para: Sets the layout of the window.

parameterdescription.para: The layout to set.

briefdescription.para: Changes the window look set in the constructor to look.

simplesect.para: B_OK on success or an error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Sets how often B_PULSE messages are posted to the window.

detaileddescription.para: All BViews attached to a window share the same pulse rate.
rate should not be set to less than 100,000 microseconds, differences less than 50,000 microseconds may not be noticeable.
Setting the rate to 0 disables pulsing for all views attache to the window.

parameterdescription.para: The pulse rate to set.

memberdef.argsstring: (float minWidth, float maxWidth, float minHeight, float maxHeight)
memberdef.name: SetSizeLimits

briefdescription.para: Set size limits on the window.

detaileddescription.para: The user won't be able to resize the window beyond the limits set by this method. SetSizeLimits() constrains the user, not the programmer, you may still resize the window outside of the size limits set by this method by calling ResizeBy() or ResizeTo().

parameterdescription.para: The minimum width of the window to set.
The maximum width of the window to set.
The minimum height of the window to set.
The maximum height of the window to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the window title to title.

detaileddescription.para: Also renames the window thread to "w>title" where "title" is the passed in title string.

briefdescription.para: Changes the window type set in the constructor to type.

simplesect.para: B_OK on success or an error code on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (window_alignment mode, int32 h, int32 hOffset=0, int32 width=0, int32 widthOffset=0, int32 v=0, int32 vOffset=0, int32 height=0, int32 heightOffset=0)
memberdef.name: SetWindowAlignment

briefdescription.para: Sets the alignment of the content of the window on the screen.
Sets the set of workspaces where the window can be displayed.

listitem.para: B_CURRENT_WORKSPACE to place the window in the currently displayed workspace removing it from all others.
B_ALL_WORKSPACES to make the window show up in all workspaces.

briefdescription.para: Sets the maximum size that the window will zoom to when Zoom() is called.

detaileddescription.para: The window will zoom to the minimum of the screen size, the maximum values set by SetSizeLimits(), and the maximum values set by this method.
/see Zoom()

briefdescription.para: Shows the window on screen, places it frontmost on the screen, adds the window to Deskbar's window list, and makes it the active window.

detaileddescription.para: If this is the first time Show() has been called on the window the message loop is started and it is unlocked.
Calls to Hide() and Show() are cumulative.

briefdescription.para: Returns the size of the window.

simplesect.para: The size of the window as a BSize in the screen coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Synchronizes the attached window's connection to App Server causing any pending messages to be processed and then waits for the App Server to respond.
Returns the window title as set by the constructor or SetTitle().

simplesect.para: A pointer to the window title.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current window type flag.

simplesect.para: The currently set window type flag.

briefdescription.para: Invokes Draw() immediately on each child view that needs updating.

detaileddescription.para: This method is synchronous, it waits for each child view to update before returning. This method is ignored unless it is called from within the message loop of the thread that the BWindow is running in.
You may call this method as part of a hook function such as MouseMoved() or KeyDown() to force invalid views to be immediately redrawn without having to wait for the hook function to finish.

briefdescription.para: Updates the window's size limits from the minimum and maximum sizes of its top view.

detaileddescription.para: This method does nothing unless the B_AUTO_UPDATE_SIZE_LIMITS window flag is set.

The method is called automatically after a layout invalidation. Since it is invoked asynchronously, calling this method manually is necessary, if it is desired to adjust the limits (and as a possible side effect the window size) earlier, e.g. before the first call to the Show() method.)

briefdescription.para: Hook method that gets called when the window becomes activated or deactivated.

parameterdescription.para: true if the window has become activated, false if the window has become deactivated.

briefdescription.para: Hook method that gets called when the active workspace changes.

detaileddescription.para: This method is only called when a workspace in which the window resides is activated or deactivated.

parameterdescription.para: The workspace number that was activated/deactivated.
true if activated, false if deactivated.

briefdescription.para: Returns the set of workspaces where the window can be displayed.
Hook method that gets called whenever the workspaces the window is in changes.

parameterdescription.para: The old set of workspaces the window was visible in.
The new set of workspaces the window is visible in.

briefdescription.para: Resize the window to the minimum of the screen size, the maximum values set by SetSizeLimits(), and the maximum values set by SetZoomLimits().

detaileddescription.para: You may call Zoom() even if the window has the B_NOT_ZOOMABLE flag set.
This is the method called when the user clicks the window's zoom button. It can also be called programmatically.

The window dimensions are calculated from the smallest of three rectangles:
the screen frame,
the rectangle defined by SetZoomLimits(),
the rectangle defined by SetSizeLimits().
However if the window frame already matches these new dimensions, Zoom() uses the previous size and location of the window instead.
This method calls Zoom(BPoint, float, float) to do the actualy zooming.

briefdescription.para: Move window to origin, then resize to width and height.

detaileddescription.para: You may call Zoom() even if the window has the B_NOT_ZOOMABLE flag set.
This method may move and resize the window resulting in both the FrameMoved() and FrameResized() hook methods to be called.
You can override this method to change how your window behaves when the user clicks the zoom button or when Zoom() is called.

parameterdescription.para: The point that the window was moved to.
The new width of the window.
The new height of the window.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BWindow object from the data message.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the BMessage object to build the object from.

simplesect.para: A newly created BWindow object or NULL if the message doesn't contain an archived BWindow.

briefdescription.para: Offscreen bitmap constructor.

parameterdescription.para: The inner frame rectangle in the screen coordinate system.
Token to pass into App Server for offscreen window bitmap.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, const char *title, window_look look, window_feel feel, uint32 flags, uint32 workspace, int32 bitmapToken=-1)
memberdef.name: _InitData

briefdescription.para: Window base class.

detaileddescription.para: A BWindow is an on-screen window which contains views and is the target of keyboard and mouse events. A BWindow instance is nearly always subclassed.
BWindow draws by talking to App Server. If you want draw directly into the graphics card by-passing App Server, you need to use a BDirectWindow or BWindowScreen.

Despite the fact that BWindow inherits from BLooper, you should not invoke Run() on a BWindow, instead, call Show() to get the message loop started and show the window on screen. Once you've called Show() you may remove a window from the screen without interrupting the message loop by calling Hide(). Other message loop details such as locking and quitting are detailed in the BLooper class.
BWindow has the following built-in shortcuts:

entry.para: Send window and go to left workspace
Send window and go to right workspace
Send window and go to above workspace
Send window and go to below workspace
